Package dev.jcputney.elearning.parser.output.scorm2004

Class SequencingInfo

java.lang.Object
dev.jcputney.elearning.parser.output.scorm2004.SequencingInfo
public class SequencingInfo extends Object
Represents generic sequencing information for eLearning modules, encapsulating rules, navigation flow, and objectives to support multiple eLearning standards (SCORM, xAPI, AICC, etc.).

This class is designed to be flexible, allowing for various rule types, objective tracking, and navigation configurations that may apply to different module types beyond SCORM.

  • Method Details

    • getPreConditionRules

      public List<String> getPreConditionRules()
      Retrieves the list of pre-condition rules. These rules determine if an activity should begin based on the learner's prior progress or conditions.
      Returns:
      List of pre-condition rule identifiers or expressions.

    • getPostConditionRules

      public List<String> getPostConditionRules()
      Retrieves the list of post-condition rules. These rules specify conditions that apply once an activity is completed, potentially affecting the next steps in sequencing.
      Returns:
      List of post-condition rule identifiers or expressions.

    • getExitConditionRules

      public List<String> getExitConditionRules()
      Retrieves the list of exit-condition rules. These rules define conditions that apply when an activity ends, controlling what occurs upon exiting or leaving the activity.
      Returns:
      List of exit-condition rule identifiers or expressions.

    • getObjectiveIds

      public List<String> getObjectiveIds()
      Retrieves the list of objective IDs associated with this sequencing information. Objectives can be used to track learning goals or completion metrics.
      Returns:
      List of objective identifiers.

    • isFlow

      public boolean isFlow()
      Indicates if the module supports linear flow through activities. If true, activities are presented in a defined order; if false, learners may access activities in a non-linear fashion.
      Returns:
      True if linear flow is enabled; false otherwise.

    • isForwardOnly

      public boolean isForwardOnly()
      Indicates if the module allows only forward navigation through content. If true, learners cannot revisit previous content once they progress to the next activity.
      Returns:
      True if only forward navigation is allowed; false otherwise.
